overview_of_class: The Xicanx (also referred to as Chican@ or Chicana/o) Movement was/is an activist struggle led by indigenous organizers, artists, and intellectuals (largely youth of Mexican descent) of North America (also known as Anahuac and Turtle Island). It that has a unique impact on how we understand race, colonialism, capitalism, imperialism and heteropatriarchy in the U.S. and beyond and corresponds with the Black Power, Red Power, U.S. Third World Left and other movements. This course will analyze and theorize the circumstances that produced the Xicanx Movement in order to facilitate a critical conversation regarding its relevance today.
